didoss@... wrote:
> maybeIfYouGetToTheTestThatHasTheInterminiblyLongName_ThatIsAnIndicationThatThereIsEntirelyTooMuchToTestInThatOneTestClass?

Maybe.  My point was less about the names getting too long, and more 
that even pushAddsOneElement still takes more time and effort for me to 
read than "push adds one element".  However, I'm conditioned to pay more 
attention to method names than either annotations or javadoc, so the 
tradeoff might still be in favor of overly descriptive method names.  
Thanks,

    David Saff
